Description: Five fragments from imported Mycenaean vessels. Four are pieces of green glazed ware, all with broken edges all round. The other one is part of the base of a vessel of fine pink pottery with a dark red-brown slip inside and a band of the same colour on the exterior. Part of the base-ring remains on the fragment.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: University of Colorado Museum
Curator's comments: See William Y Adams, The West Bank Survey from Faras to Gemai. Sudan Archaeological Research Society Publication Number 13. BAR International Series 1335 (2005).
Acquisition name: Donated by: University of Colorado Museum
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 11999 (University of Colorado Museum number)
